name: promisee
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person or group to whom a promise has been made: A promissory note is a written promise that a borrower (the promisor) will pay a sum of money to a designated person (the payee or promisee). Compare
promisor
More examplesFewer examplesA promise that a promisor made based on a moral obligation to the promisee may not be enforced. A promise is gratuitous unless the promisee is paying a price for it by giving something in retum. Promises can remain in force after the death of the promisee.No corporate officer could have authority to pledge the corporation's assets to a deal which benefits the promisee, but not the corporation.
